Performance Optimization: Continuously monitor and analyze the effectiveness of AI-generated ads, utilizing performance data to drive creative improvements and report on outcomes. 

Qualifications

Experience: At least 1 year of experience in an AI-focused role, bonus points if it is within the advertising or creative industry. Technical Skills: Proficient with AI content generation tools like Sora AI, Midjourney, Runway, Arcads, ElevenLabs, Pika AI, ChatGPT, among others. Strong understanding of the advertising production process. Education: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, AI, Marketing, or related field preferred. Portfolio: Must submit a portfolio showcasing past projects with AI tools, ideally related to advertising. 

Location

Ruby Labs operates within the CET (Central European Time) zone. Applicants from any country are welcome to apply for the position as long as they are located within approximately ± 4 hours of CET. This ensures optimal collaboration and communication during working hours.

Benefits

Discover the perks of being part of our vibrant team! We offer:

Remote Work Environment: Embrace the freedom to work from anywhere, anytime, promoting a healthy work-life balance. 🏡⏰Unlimited PTO: Enjoy unlimited paid time off to recharge and prioritize your well-being, without counting days. 🌴💼Paid National Holidays: Celebrate and relax on national holidays with paid time off to unwind and recharge. 🎉🌟Company-provided MacBook: Experience seamless productivity with top-notch Apple MacBooks provided to all employees who need them. 💻🚀Flexible Independent Contractor Agreement: Unlock the benefits of flexibility, autonomy, and entrepreneurial opportunities. Benefit from tax advantages, networking opportunities, reduced employment obligations, and the freedom to work from anywhere. Read more about it here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1dHF4ctKlez75whdn-ybUwP5d5Wr0BdwVrorrm_fM40Q/preview 📈💼

Be part of our fast-growing team and seize this excellent opportunity for personal and professional growth!

Interview Process

Application Submission: Provide your CV along with a portfolio showcasing a variety of AI-generated projects. Recruiter Screening (30 minutes): Discuss your background, experience, and fit for the role. Task Assignment: Demonstrate your skills with AI tools through a practical task related to ad production. Final Interview (60 minutes): Meet with the Ad Creative Director and CEO to discuss your vision for the role and potential impact at Ruby Labs. 

Life at Ruby Labs

At Ruby Labs, we are more than a team; we're a community united in pushing the boundaries of technology and innovation. Our combined passion fuels our ambition for excellence, driving impact that resonates around the globe.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that a diversity of thought and backgrounds builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, religion, color, place of birth, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military service status, or disability status. title: Prompt Engineer / Gen AI
description:
PROMPT ENGINEERING - GEN AIML/AI - LLM'sSalary negotiableLocation negotiable
We are looking for an expert developer who has moved into Prompt Engineering. You must have a solid development background using Python and any additional tools and languages such as Java, .net, AWS, Azure etc. We are looking for candidates who have at least 5 years work experience and have been developing agents and writing prompts for the last 2 years. 
You will be the expert inhouse consultant for Prompt Engineering and will be writing prompts and building agents using the latest and most relevant LLM's.
The company are in the financial services sector and have about 150 people and are growing fast.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Legal Prompt Engineer
description:
At Thomson Reuters, you will have the opportunity to influence and lead the global knowledge economy. Our innovative technology supports international markets and empowers professionals worldwide to make impactful decisions. By addressing both current challenges and future ambitions, you will collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry on diverse projects, crafting next-generation solutions that achieve significant results. As the foremost provider of intelligent information, we value your unique perspective to drive solutions that propel our business forward and enhance your career development.

We are in search of a driven Senior Software Engineer - Prompt Engineer with a background in law and experience working with APIs, complemented by domain expertise in the legal field (such as a JD or experience in the legal industry). You will collaborate with a very experienced team to build applications utilizing state-of-the-art Large Language Models (LLMs) that deliver cutting-edge and time-saving solutions to attorneys nationwide.

About The Role

As the Senior Software Engineer - Prompt Engineer, you will:

Orchestrate LLM-driven experiences that delight our customersDevelop code that interacts with state-of-the-art LLMsWrite, test, and iterate prose prompts for the LLM that leverage your legal domain knowledge, ensuring delivery of accurate, legally sound, and contextually appropriate responsesDevelop code that interacts with data sources & services (APIs, SQL databases, etc.)Collaborate with legal professionals and internal teams at Thomson Reuters to gather and comprehend requirementsIntegrate language models into multi-step systems, assessing their performance and making necessary modifications


About You

You’re a fit for the role of the Senior Software Engineer - Prompt Engineer if you have:

Legal domain expertise:Experience in legal practiceJD-holder in a “non-traditional” legal career pathParalegal or other legal industry experience3 to 4 years of production level experience in software engineering on an engineering/product teamProficiency in C# .NET / Python (or strong experience in other programming languages if C# .NET / Python skills are low)Proficiency with APIs and SQL is a major plusExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to work both independently and in a collaborative environmentCreative and clear writing skillsExperience using large language models through code is preferred (such as model services from OpenAI, Anthropic, or Cohere; and/or open source models such as Llama and Mistral)

Join our team at Thomson Reuters and contribute to the next wave of technological innovation in the legal industry.

What's in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connectedWellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.Social Impact: Ten employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.


In the United States, Thomson Reuters offers a comprehensive benefits package to our employees. Our benefit package includes market competitive health, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance programs, as well as a competitive 401k plan with company match. In addition, Thomson Reuters offers market leading work life benefits with competitive vacation, sick and safe paid time off, paid holidays (including two company mental health days off), parental leave, sabbatical leave. These benefits meet or exceeds the requirements of paid time off in accordance with any applicable state or municipal laws. Finally, Thomson Reuters offers the following additional benefits: optional hospital, accident and sickness insurance paid 100% by the employee; optional life and AD&D insurance paid 100% by the employee; Flexible Spending and Health Savings Accounts; fitness reimbursement; access to Employee Assistance Program; Group Legal Identity Theft Protection benefit paid 100% by employee; access to 529 Plan; commuter benefits; Adoption & Surrogacy Assistance; Tuition Reimbursement; and access to Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

Thomson Reuters complies with local laws that require upfront disclosure of the expected pay range for a position. The base compensation range varies across locations.

For any eligible US locations, unless otherwise noted, the base compensation range for this role is $88,200 - $163,800.

This role may also be eligible for an Annual Bonus based on a combination of enterprise and individual performance.

Base pay is positioned within the range based on several factors including an individual’s knowledge, skills and experience with consideration given to internal equity. Base pay is one part of a comprehensive Total Reward program which also includes flexible and supportive benefits and other wellbeing programs.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com.

title: Prompt Engineer
description:
Hi, we're The Browser Company 👋 and we're building a better way to use the internet.

Browsers are unique in that they are one of the only pieces of software that you share with your parents as well as your kids. Which makes sense, they're our doorway to the most important things — through them we socialize with loved ones, work on our passion projects, and explore our curiosities. But on their own, they don’t actually do a whole lot, they’re kind of just there. They don’t help us organize our messy lives or make it easier to compose our ideas. We believe that the browser could do so much more — it can empower and support the amazing things we do on the internet. That’s why we’re building one: a browser that can help us grow, create, and stay curious.

To accomplish this lofty task, we’re building a diverse team of people from different backgrounds and experiences. This isn’t optional, it’s crucial to our mission, as we need a wide range of perspectives to challenge our assumptions and shape our browser through a bold, creative lens. With that in mind, we especially encourage women, people of color, and others from historically marginalized groups to apply.

About The Role

As The Browser Company’s second Prompt Engineer, you will play a crucial role in shaping how our new web browser, Dia, interacts with users. You will be responsible for creating and iterating on prompts while considering effective, scalable systems for leveraging large language models (LLMs). You’ll work closely with Product and Engineering teams to define how Dia understands and responds to users, setting a new standard for seamless and intelligent web browser experiences.

Overall you will...

Develop, experiment with, and refine prompts to achieve desired outputs from large language models (LLMs). Continuously iterate on prompts based on feedback, testing, and evaluation data. Collaborate with Product and Engineering teams to understand user needs and translate requirements into prompt strategies and solutions. Work closely with Engineering teams to build tools that streamline prompt iteration, prompt tuning, and LLM evaluation pipelines. Maintain detailed documentation of prompts and share best practices across the company. Stay at the forefront on emerging trends, models, and frameworks in AI and LLMs. 

Qualifications

Currently an advanced user of ChatGPT or Claude who relies on a wide-range of custom prompts for your weekly usageExperience in product, engineering, or design, with hands-on experience taking a product from concept to its initial release (v1)A willingness to constantly iterate on prompts and develop creative solutions to achieve expected outcomes. A strong interest in staying up-to-date with the latest developments in AI and LLM technologies, particularly how they can be applied to real-world products. Ability to translate product direction and requirements into effective prompts that deliver on user needs. 

Compensation And Benefits

This is a 3-month contract-to-hire position. Hourly pay range is $70–100 per hour, based on experience and qualifications. 

Once converted to FTE, we offer a competitive salary and equity package. In addition, we provide every employee with the following benefits:

comprehensive benefits package with employee medical, dental, and vision - we cover 100% of premiums for employees, and up to 95% for dependents401k planflexible vacation policy - on average, our team members take between 15-20 vacation days plus federal holidays (holidays vary by location)remote-friendly working environment - our core working hours are 11 AM-2 PM Eastern Time, Monday-Friday12 weeks of paid parental leave$1,500 USD home office stipendEmployees based in the US also receive additional services like free annual memberships to One Medical (where available), Talkspace, Teladoc, and HealthAdvocate

The Browser Company is a well-funded, ambitious startup of about 85 people (and growing!) who are passionate about building great products. We are a remote-first, distributed team, with the option to work in office in New York. We strongly support diversity and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply.

🚙 To read more about what we value as a company, check out Notes on Roadtrips on our blog.

title: Senior Software Engineer - Legal Prompt Engineer
description:
Job Description

At Thomson Reuters, you will have the opportunity to influence and lead the global knowledge economy. Our innovative technology supports international markets and empowers professionals worldwide to make impactful decisions. By addressing both current challenges and future ambitions, you will collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry on diverse projects, crafting next-generation solutions that achieve significant results. As the foremost provider of intelligent information, we value your unique perspective to drive solutions that propel our business forward and enhance your career development.

We are in search of a driven Senior Software Engineer - Prompt Engineer with a background in law and experience working with APIs, complemented by domain expertise in the legal field (such as a JD or experience in the legal industry). You will collaborate with a very experienced team to build applications utilizing state-of-the-art Large Language Models (LLMs) that deliver cutting-edge and time-saving solutions to attorneys nationwide.

About The Role

As the Senior Software Engineer - Prompt Engineer, you will:

Orchestrate LLM-driven experiences that delight our customersDevelop code that interacts with state-of-the-art LLMsWrite, test, and iterate prose prompts for the LLM that leverage your legal domain knowledge, ensuring delivery of accurate, legally sound, and contextually appropriate responsesDevelop code that interacts with data sources & services (APIs, SQL databases, etc.)Collaborate with legal professionals and internal teams at Thomson Reuters to gather and comprehend requirementsIntegrate language models into multi-step systems, assessing their performance and making necessary modifications

About You

You’re a fit for the role of the Senior Software Engineer - Prompt Engineer if you have:

Legal domain expertise:Experience in legal practiceJD-holder in a “non-traditional” legal career pathParalegal or other legal industry experience3 to 4 years of production level experience in software engineering on an engineering/product teamProficiency in C# .NET / Python (or strong experience in other programming languages if C# .NET / Python skills are low)Proficiency with APIs and SQL is a major plusExcellent analytical and problem-solving skillsAbility to work both independently and in a collaborative environmentCreative and clear writing skillsExperience using large language models through code is preferred (such as model services from OpenAI, Anthropic, or Cohere; and/or open source models such as Llama and Mistral)
Join our team at Thomson Reuters and contribute to the next wave of technological innovation in the legal industry.

What's in it For You?

You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your personal and professional growth through:

Hybrid Work Model: We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working environment (2-3 days a week in the office depending on the role) for our office-based roles while delivering a seamless experience that is digitally and physically connectedWellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; flexible and supportive benefits for work-life balance: flexible vacation, two company-wide Mental Health Days Off; work from another location for up to a total of 8 weeks in a year, 4 of those weeks can be out of the country and the remaining in the country, Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.Social Impact: Ten employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.Purpose Driven Work: We have a superpower that we’ve never talked about with as much pride as we should – we are one of the only companies on the planet that helps its customers pursue justice, truth and transparency. Together, with the professionals and institutions we serve, we help uphold the rule of law, turn the wheels of commerce, catch bad actors, report the facts, and provide trusted, unbiased information to people all over the world.

In the United States, Thomson Reuters offers a comprehensive benefits package to our employees. Our benefit package includes market competitive health, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance programs, as well as a competitive 401k plan with company match. In addition, Thomson Reuters offers market leading work life benefits with competitive vacation, sick and safe paid time off, paid holidays (including two company mental health days off), parental leave, sabbatical leave. These benefits meet or exceeds the requirements of paid time off in accordance with any applicable state or municipal laws. Finally, Thomson Reuters offers the following additional benefits: optional hospital, accident and sickness insurance paid 100% by the employee; optional life and AD&D insurance paid 100% by the employee; Flexible Spending and Health Savings Accounts; fitness reimbursement; access to Employee Assistance Program; Group Legal Identity Theft Protection benefit paid 100% by employee; access to 529 Plan; commuter benefits; Adoption & Surrogacy Assistance; Tuition Reimbursement; and access to Employee Stock Purchase Plan.

Thomson Reuters complies with local laws that require upfront disclosure of the expected pay range for a position. The base compensation range varies across locations.

For any eligible US locations, unless otherwise noted, the base compensation range for this role is $88,200 - $163,800.

This role may also be eligible for an Annual Bonus based on a combination of enterprise and individual performance.

Base pay is positioned within the range based on several factors including an individual’s knowledge, skills and experience with consideration given to internal equity. Base pay is one part of a comprehensive Total Reward program which also includes flexible and supportive benefits and other wellbeing programs.

Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.

We are powered by the talents of 26,000 employees across more than 70 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.

Accessibility 

As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.

We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.

Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.

More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on https://thomsonreuters.com.

title: Prompt Engineer
description:
Welcome to Byborg! As a leader in IT and streaming solutions, we deliver high-quality services for premium online experiences.
Headquartered in Luxembourg and operating globally, our company is proud of its diversity, with over 40 different nationalities working side by side. Since its launch, our flagship product has led the market, continually pushing the boundaries of digital innovation and today our platforms serve millions of users daily.
Working with a wide range of cutting-edge technologies and constantly pushing the envelope in AI experimentation, we ensure robust and reliable performance through our powerful network of data centers. Furthermore, our advanced design and testing methods, including Behavior-Driven Development, set us apart.
We are proud of our dynamic portfolio, featuring over 16 leading and fast-growing brands. These include our streaming platforms (LiveJasmin.com, Cherry.TV, IsLive.com, Oranum.com), our marketing and advertising services (AdSupply, AWEmpire, TwinRed), and our entertainment and lifestyle brands (LoyalFans.com, The Million Roses, Kinkly.com).
Are you looking for new challenges in an international, collaborative environment? The Byborg squad is seeking passionate individuals ready to make an impact. Join us in our inclusive workplace where you will be appreciated, and you can grow and achieve your potential. Help us shape the future!
Job DescriptionCreate and Optimize Prompts: Design, develop, and refine high-quality prompts for large language models (LLMs) and image-generative AI systems to ensure relevant, accurate, and creative outputs tailored to business needs.Experiment and Iterate: Conduct experiments with different prompt formulations to identify effective strategies for improving model behavior, accuracy, and creativity. Iterate based on results and feedback.Collaborate Across Teams: Work closely with machine learning engineers, data scientists, and product teams to understand project requirements and incorporate prompt design into model development processes.Monitor and Evaluate Model Performance: Track and evaluate the performance of prompts across various model versions and applications, identifying opportunities for improvements in prompt efficacy.Stay Current on AI Trends: Keep up to date with the latest advancements in natural language processing (NLP) and generative models, including new techniques for prompt engineering and optimization.Document and Share Knowledge: Maintain thorough documentation on prompt development practices, learnings, and best practices. Share insights across teams to ensure consistency and continuous improvement.
QualificationsPrompt Engineering Experience: At least 1 year of experience in prompt engineering, with a demonstrated ability to create and optimize effective prompts for generative AI models.Experience with AI Models: Hands-on experience with different types of large language models (e.g., GPT, BERT) or image generation models (e.g., DALL·E, Stable Diffusion).Strong Communication Skills: Ability to clearly express prompt strategies and model behavior to both technical and non-technical team members.Analytical and Iterative Mindset: Strong problem-solving skills with an ability to design and evaluate experiments to improve model outputs. Comfort with iteration and adapting strategies based on feedback.Creative Thinking: Ability to think creatively and push the boundaries of model outputs through innovative prompt designs.
Preferred But Not Required QualificationsExperience with various generative AI tools and platforms (e.g., OpenAI, Hugging Face, Google Cloud AI, etc.).Familiarity with Python or other programming languages commonly used in AI/ML tasks is desirable. Understanding of AI model behavior and fine-tuning is a plus.Familiarity with model fine-tuning and how it relates to prompt performance.Previous work in a collaborative, cross-functional environment with data scientists, engineers, and product managers.
What We OfferAn exceptional compensation packageYour health is our wealth: We will offer you a private health insurance and an AYCM sportspassCafeteria benefit (gross 500.000 Ft / year)The opportunity to see your work directly contribute to the success of the companyWhen you grow, we grow: You have the chance to attend events, meetups, and other perks for your professional growthYou’re joining the #ByborgSquad and you are going to look the part! We give out company-branded merchandise to every new joinerAnd of course, a fun, professional, and collaborative work culture
Byborg Enterprises is an equal employment opportunity employer. We consider individuals for employment based on their skills, abilities and experience. We thrive to attract and hire a strong, talented and diverse workforce, prohibiting discrimination based on race, color, religious or political beliefs, age, nationality, physical, mental or developmental disability, gender, sexual orientation.
DISCLAIMER: This job description is a summary of the primary duties and responsibilities of the job and position. It is not intended to be a comprehensive or all-inclusive listing of duties and responsibilities. Contents are subject to change at management's discretion.Final candidate will be requested to provide with a recent criminal record extract for background screening purpose.
NOTE: Byborg Enterprises does not accept unsolicited resumes from agencies. We consider any resume (CV) or biography received from an agency without prior approval from our Legal and Recruiting Department to be unsolicited, and such submissions will not be recognized for purposes of “ownership” of the candidate.

title: AI Prompt Engineer
description:

title: Prompt Engineer - Remote India
description:
Job Description

This is a remote position.

Job Summary -

We are looking for a creative and highly skilled Prompt Engineer with 2-5 years of experience to join our AI/ML team. As a Prompt Engineer, you will be responsible for designing and optimizing prompts that enhance the performance of large language models (LLMs) and other AI models. Your role will focus on improving model responses, creating innovative solutions, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to deploy AI-driven applications.

Job Responsibilities

 Design, test, and refine prompts to optimize the performance of AI/ML models, especially large language models (LLMs).Collaborate with AI teams to understand model behavior and improve response generation.Develop and implement prompt engineering strategies for various use cases, including chatbots, virtual assistants, and other AI applications.Research and apply prompt engineering best practices to enhance AI model outputs.Continuously experiment with different prompt structures to maximize relevance and accuracy.Analyze model outputs and use insights to adjust and improve prompts.Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and product teams to integrate prompt engineering into product development.Keep up to date with advancements in AI/ML, particularly in LLMs, generative AI, and natural language processing (NLP).

Requirements

Candidate Required Skills:

Bachelor's degree in Engineering (BE/B.Tech-CS/IT) or a Master's degree in Computer Applications (MCA) or an equivalent qualification.4-8 years of experience working with AI/ML models, with a focus on prompt engineering or related areas.Strong knowledge of large language models (LLMs) such as GPT, BERT, and other NLP models.Proficiency in natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning techniques.Experience with prompt design and fine-tuning model responses for AI-powered applications.Familiarity with programming languages such as Python and experience with AI/ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face).Strong analytical skills to evaluate model performance and improve prompt effectiveness.Creative problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically about model outputs.Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work within cross-functional teams.

Benefits

This role offers the flexibility of working remotely in India.

We are an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other protected status. We encourage a diverse range of applicants.

title: AI Prompt Engineer
description:
Who we are?

Join Seattle New Media, where innovation meets reliability. As one of Seattle’s premier low-code agencies, we’re at the forefront of delivering world-class website design and development solutions that empower leading global brands. Our specialties include crafting dynamic Webflow CMS sites, robust ecommerce platforms, and seamless integrations with leading low-code systems like Airtable, Xano, Bubble, and Integromat. With a keen eye for SEO and decades of combined experience in custom web design, development, and digital marketing, we create captivating websites that convert visitors into customers and fuel business growth. At Seattle New Media, we turn visions into digital masterpieces.

Why work with us?

100% Remote: Work from anywhere in the world, no office required.Promote from Within: We prioritize internal growth and development.Low-Stress Environment: Manageable workloads for a stress-free workday.Work Independently: Embrace autonomy in how you work.Friendly Team: Upholding a supportive and respectful work environment based on the golden rule.Innovative Projects: Collaborate on cutting-edge digital solutions for global brands.

Employment Type: Full-Time

Working Hours: 7:00 PM to 4:00 AM IST, Monday to Friday (Fully Remote)

Overview

We are looking for an AI Prompt Engineer to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing, testing, and optimizing AI prompts to improve the performance of AI models, particularly in natural language processing and generation. You will work closely with other team members to create high-quality prompts that drive innovation and enhance user experience.

Responsibilities

Develop and refine prompts to effectively interact with AI models, ensuring high-quality, accurate, and relevant responses.Collaborate with AI researchers and developers to understand model capabilities and limitations, optimizing prompts for better model performance.Test and evaluate AI responses, analyzing performance and identifying areas for improvement.Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI, natural language processing, and machine learning to improve prompt engineering techniques.Contribute to the development of AI-driven applications and features, ensuring prompt-driven inputs lead to optimal outputs.Document and standardize prompt engineering processes for consistency and future scalability.

Skills & Qualifications

Strong understanding of AI, machine learning, and natural language processing (NLP) concepts.Experience with AI prompt engineering or related fields (e.g., chatbot development, language model fine-tuning).Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, with a focus on AI-related libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face).Familiarity with major AI language models (e.g., GPT, BERT) and how to optimize them for various applications.Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to design effective prompts.Excellent written and verbal communication skills to document and explain prompt strategies clearly.Familiarity in AI model deployment.

Benefits

Permanent remote work

Skills: natural language processing (nlp),problem-solving,python,language processing,hugging face,prompt,programming languages,bert,pytorch,natural language processing,ai,machine learning,ai prompt engineering,communication,ai prompt,tensorflow,gpt

title: Creative Prompt Engineer
description:
Akcelo is an independent Brand Experience agency delivering powerful brand experiences that people love. We fuse creativity with experience design to solve business problems and generate white-space opportunities for some of the world's most famous brands and businesses.
We are seeking a Creative Prompt Engineer with a love for AI innovation and creative problem-solving to join our team. title: AI Prompt Engineer
description:

Join Seattle New Media, where innovation meets reliability. As one of Seattle’s premier low-code agencies, we’re at the forefront of delivering world-class website design and development solutions that empower leading global brands. Overview

We are looking for an AI Prompt Engineer to join our dynamic team. You will work closely with other team members to create high-quality prompts that drive innovation and enhance user experience.

Skills & Qualifications

Strong understanding of AI, machine learning, and natural language processing (NLP) concepts.Experience with AI prompt engineering or related fields (e.g., chatbot development, language model fine-tuning).Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, with a focus on AI-related libraries (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face).Familiarity with major AI language models (e.g., GPT, BERT) and how to optimize them for various applications.Strong problem-solving skills and ability to think creatively to design effective prompts.Excellent written and verbal communication skills to document and explain prompt strategies clearly.Familiarity in AI model deployment.

Benefits

Permanent remote work

title: Prompt Engineer with scientific background
description:
Join our dynamic team at Global Coordination Center, a leading Chinese Business Process Outsourcing (BPO) company with a thriving presence in the Philippines. We specialize in providing innovative solutions to our clients and are looking for talented individuals to contribute to our continued success.

Brief Summary

We are seeking a Prompt Engineer with a scientific background to help optimize and refine AI language models for specialized tasks in the field of science and research. The ideal candidate will work closely with data scientists, AI engineers, and domain experts to develop, test, and fine-tune prompts that maximize the effectiveness of AI systems in producing accurate, relevant, and scientifically rigorous results. This role combines the technical skills of AI and NLP with a strong understanding of scientific concepts to enhance the utility of AI in scientific applications.

Location: Makati City, Philippines

Working Hours: 4pm to 12 Midnight Monday to Friday

Compensation: up to 40,000 - 50,000PHP per month

Responsibilities

Design, create, and refine effective natural language prompts for AI models that cater to a wide range of scientific applications, such as data analysis, hypothesis generation, literature review, experimental design, and problem-solving within specific scientific domains (e.g., biology, chemistry, physics, etc.).Work with large-scale language models and help fine-tune them to improve domain-specific knowledge, such as medical research, environmental science, or material science, by developing prompts that ensure the model understands the nuances of the scientific field.Analyze the outputs generated by AI models based on the prompts, identifying patterns, inconsistencies, and areas for improvement. Use scientific reasoning and statistical analysis to interpret results and make data-driven adjustments to the prompts.Maintain detailed documentation of prompt engineering workflows, model outputs, optimization processes, and findings. Prepare reports and presentations for internal teams or clients to explain the effectiveness and potential of AI models in scientific applications.Ensure that prompt engineering adheres to ethical guidelines, particularly in areas like data privacy, reproducibility, and unbiased AI output.Be mindful of the ethical implications of AI in scientific research and help establish protocols for responsible AI usage.Stay up-to-date on advancements in both artificial intelligence (especially in NLP) and the specific scientific fields you are working within.Integrate new methodologies, tools, and best practices into your work to continuously improve AI performance.

Qualifications

Masters in a scientific discipline (e.g., Biology, Chemistry, Physics, Engineering, Computer Science, or similar) combined with a strong understanding of AI, machine learning, and natural language processing (NLP).Experience with language models, such as GPT-3, GPT-4, or similar AI tools, and familiarity with machine learning frameworks (e.g.,TensorFlow, PyTorch, Hugging Face). Understanding of prompt engineering techniques and AI fine-tuning methodologies.Strong foundation in a specific scientific field (e.g., life sciences, environmental science, physics, or engineering). Ability to understand complex scientific concepts and translate them into AI-compatible formats.Proficiency in Python and other programming languages commonly used in AI development. Familiarity with libraries such as NumPy, pandas, and scikit-learn, as well as tools for working with machine learning models.Strong quantitative and qualitative analysis skills. Ability to approach problems creatively, apply scientific reasoning, and troubleshoot complex AI model outputs.Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Experience in preparing technical reports and presentations for scientific or business audiences.High attention to detail when testing, refining, and optimizing prompts. Ability to identify subtle differences in AI model behavior and adjust strategies accordingly.

Preferred Qualifications

Previous experience in AI research, particularly in NLP or machine learning, and applying these technologies to solve scientific problems.Experience in a specific scientific domain where AI is applied or experience in scientific data processing.

What We Offer

Competitive salaryA collaborative, interdisciplinary team environment working on cutting-edge projects.Opportunities for professional development, including training in AI and machine learning.The opportunity to contribute to impactful scientific and technological advancements through the application of AI.

Enjoy Our Perks And Benefits

 Philhealth coverage Pagibig SSS (Social Security System) 13th-month pay. Ongoing training and support to enhance your sales skills. Opportunities for promotion. Co-working space provided. Access to cutting-edge sales and CRM tools. Exciting opportunities for career growth Collaborative and inclusive workplace culture and many more!

description:

title: Junior AI Prompt Engineer (Contract)
description:
About Us:

Hippocratic AI has developed a safety-focused Large Language Model (LLM) for healthcare. The company believes that a safe LLM can dramatically improve healthcare accessibility and health outcomes in the world by bringing deep healthcare expertise to every human. No other technology has the potential to have this level of global impact on health.

Why Join Our Team:

Innovative Mission: We are developing a safe, healthcare-focused large language model (LLM) designed to revolutionize health outcomes on a global scale. Visionary Leadership: Hippocratic AI was co-founded by CEO Munjal Shah, alongside a group of physicians, hospital administrators, healthcare professionals, and artificial intelligence researchers from leading institutions, including El Camino Health, Johns Hopkins, Stanford, Microsoft, Google, and NVIDIA. Strategic Investors: We have raised a total of $278 million in funding, backed by top investors such as Andreessen Horowitz, General Catalyst, Kleiner Perkins, NVIDIA’s NVentures, Premji Invest, SV Angel, and six health systems. World-Class Team: Our team is composed of leading experts in healthcare and artificial intelligence, ensuring our technology is safe, effective, and capable of delivering meaningful improvements to healthcare delivery and outcomes. 

For more information, visit www.HippocraticAI.com.

Our team values in-person collaboration, with on-site presence expected five days a week in Palo Alto, CA unless otherwise specified.

About the Role:

We're seeking a Junior AI Engineer, Prompting to join our collaborative team of engineers, scientists, and healthcare professionals working on transformative AI solutions. In this role, you'll help develop and maintain our conversation layer using a mix of software and prompting skills to allow our AI agent facilitate autonomous conversations.

What You’ll Do:

Develop complex prompts in our SOTA conversation planning layer to enable complex agentic model workflowsCollaborate with Product Managers, Software Engineers and Clinicians to create fully autonomous, clinical conversations. Write, configure and iterate on prompts to create engaging, patient-oriented conversationsUse advanced prompting techniques to develop and optimize prompts for language models to improve model performance, clinical safety, and patient experience. Conduct experiments and analyze outcomes of model outputs to refine and iterate on prompt strategies. 

What We’re Looking For (Must-Have):

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent coursework/projects). Familiarity with Python through coursework, internships, or personal projects. Experience with LLM prompting (chatGPT, Claude, etc) through professional or personal useExposure to working with databases and building simple RESTful APIs. Strong problem-solving mindset and eagerness to learn new technologies. 

Nice-to-Have (But Not Required):

Experience with personal or academic projects involving backend development. Basic understanding of AI/ML concepts or a desire to learn about them. Knowledge of modern web frameworks (e.g., Flask, Django, or Spring Boot). Awareness of data privacy and security best practices, especially in regulated environments. 

Why Join Us:

Be part of an innovative team creating impactful AI solutions in the healthcare space. Receive mentorship and hands-on training to advance your technical and professional skills. Collaborate in a supportive, team-driven environment that values learning and development. Work on meaningful projects with real-world applications in patient care. 

We’re excited to meet passionate engineers who are eager to make a difference. If you’re enthusiastic about learning and applying your skills to cutting-edge technology, we encourage you to apply!

title: Prompt Engineer
description:
The Prompt Engineer optimizes prompts to generative AI models across NICE's Illuminate applications. As part of the Illuminate Research team, the Prompt Engineer works with several groups in the business to help our applications deliver the highest quality customer experience.
The Prompt Engineer partners with global development teams to help diagnose and resolve prompt-based issues. This includes helping to define and execute tests for LLM-based systems that are difficult to evaluate with traditional test automation tools. The Prompt Engineer also helps educate the development teams on advances in prompt engineering and helps update production prompts to evolving industry best practices.
When a customer needs to address novel requirements with a custom prompt, the Prompt Engineer partners with customer-facing teams such as Professional Services and Product Management to capture the customer's needs and develop a robust, well-tested prompting solution. This includes devising and executing custom test plans, as well as presenting quantitative test results to internal stakeholders.
The Prompt Engineer also works with other members of the research team to evaluate new techniques and models. Data collection is a big part of this work, coordinating internal domain experts and external labeling teams to build high-quality datasets. The Prompt Engineer also builds cloud-based proof-of-concept applications to help evaluate and demonstrate new AI technology.
RESPONSIBILITIES* Review production prompts for problems and potential improvements.* Educate global development teams on state-of-the-art best practices in prompt engineering.* Help diagnose and resolve issues with production prompts.* Work with customer-facing stakeholders to capture customers' goals for generative AI applications.* Refine prompts to generative AI systems to achieve customer goals.* Build software tools and prototypes to help compare alternative solutions.* Collect and present quantitative analysis on solution success.* Consult with Machine Learning Engineers for more challenging problems.* Help evaluate evolving AI-based tools from other members of the Research team.* Collect data to refine solutions, models, and analysis frameworks.* Coordinate with internal domain experts and data labeling teams to build datasets.* Stay informed about new advances in prompt engineering.
REQUIRED* BS in technology-related field such as computer science, business intelligence/analytics, or finance.* Three years' work experience in a technology-related industry or position.* Familiarity with best practices in prompt engineering, to include differences in prompts between major LLM vendors.* Ability to develop and maintain good working relationships with cross-functional teams.* Ability to clearly communicate and present to internal and external stakeholders.* Experience with Python and at least one web app framework for prototyping, e.g., Streamlit or Flask.
PREFERRED* Basic AWS resource management, including microservice deployment.* Containerization via Docker.* Awareness of basic data science and generative AI methods.* Exposure to generative AI application frameworks like LangChain, LlamaIndex, and griptape.
About NICENICE Ltd. (NASDAQ: NICE) software products are used by 25,000+ global businesses, including 85 of the Fortune 100 corporations, to deliver extraordinary customer experiences, fight financial crime and ensure public safety. Every day, NICE software manages more than 120 million customer interactions and monitors 3+ billion financial transactions.

Your opportunity for impact

NetDocuments is seeking an experienced Prompt Engineer specializing in Document Automation to provide effective and innovative solutions within a presales environment. The ideal candidate will have strong knowledge of legal document workflows and will collaborate with legal teams to build document automation solutions that address specific client needs. A strong interest in AI prompting is heavily desired.

Develop and Implement Custom Apps: Utilize NetDocuments no-code/low-code PatternBuilder and PatternBuilder MAX to create document automation and workflow solutions tailored to customer needs.Collaborate with Legal Teams: Work closely with the NetDocuments Solutions Expert Team and stakeholders to gather requirements and design solutions that improve efficiency, with a focus on creating compelling demonstrations and proof-of-concepts that accelerate sales cycles and increase deal closure rates.Prompt Design & Iteration: Develop and refine AI prompts for tasks such as text generation, data extraction, and creative writing.Analyze and Iterate on Prompts: Review performance metrics and user feedback to refine prompts and ensure high-quality outputs.Experiments & Research: Conduct experiments to test new prompting techniques and optimize existing workflows to improve performance.Other duties as assigned

Experience in legal document automation (3+ years) and expertise in automation platforms such as PatternBuilder, HotDocs, or similar tools.Technical skills: Proficient in no-code/low-code platforms, designing dynamic document templates, workflows, and logic formulas.Legal knowledge: Familiarity with common legal documents and industry compliance requirements.Analytical mindset: Strong problem-solving ability to identify areas for improvement through automation.Attention to detail: High level of accuracy in document creation and workflow automation.Collaboration and communication skills: Ability to work effectively with legal professionals and non-technical stakeholders, explaining complex concepts in an understandable manner.Project management: Capacity to handle multiple projects, meeting deadlines while maintaining quality standards.Familiarity with AI prompting and a keen interest in developing AI-driven solutions coupled with a commitment to continuous learning and staying up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI and prompt engineering technologies.

Ideally you will have

3+ years of experience in legal document automation or a related field.Proficiency with document automation tools such as PatternBuilder, HotDocs, or similar platforms.Strong understanding of legal workflows and compliance requirements within the legal industry.Ability to collaborate with legal teams and non-technical stakeholders to deliver solutions.Experience with AI technologies and prompting is highly desired though not required – Moreso, a willingness to learn and apply AI in innovative ways.

(e.g., OpenAI, Anthropic) and using pre-trained AI models for real-world applications. for developing backend services and APIs for AI-powered applications. for building interactive front-end interfaces for AI-driven applications.

title: Senior Prompt Engineer
description:
Overview

Job Title: Senior Prompt Engineer

Report To: Prompt Engineering Manager

Location: Bangalore / Hyderabad / Chennai / Coimbatore

Position: Full-time

Department: Annalect Engineering

Position Overview

Prompt Engineer is an emerging role at Annalect, which plays a key role in developing our advanced generative AI capabilities. Prompt engineers work closely with business, product, and engineering stakeholders to create valuable and amazong AI capabilities with LLMs and other AI capabilities.

Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

Develop and evaluate prompts for AI agents, chatbots, and other capabilities.Develop monitoring techniques to check the accuracy and performance of models during development and production. Test and analyze outputs from AI by experimenting with different prompts/techniques. Work with application and QA teams to implement monitoring and CI/CDCombine correct techniques for querying data in alignment with the capabilities for prompts

Qualifications

Required Skills

At least 1 years of previous software engineering experience. Working experience of common software development techniques, including git, github/bitbucket pull request workflows, and intermediate python (ruby, C#, or other server language)Proven ability to write clear and specific instructions for LLM and diffusion modelsExperience with interactive problem-solving techniques. Familiarity with iterative design methodologies. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills.Solid knowledge of data structures, data formats, and data modelingUnderstanding (and preferrable practical experience) with common software architecture patterns, ability to reason about different components of the software stackPassion for Technology: Excitement for new technology, bleeding edge applications, and a positive attitude towards solving real-world challengesExcellent communication and collaboration skills

Additional Skills

BS, MS, in Computer Science, Computational Linguistics, or a related field, or equivalent real-world experienceKnowledge of Vector databases such as Pinecone or Milvus with experience in at least one type of databases (MSQL/ PSQL)Experience with LangChain and Weights & Biases is a plusFamiliarity with big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, and HiveProven ability to independently execute projects from concept to implementation and to maintain a live product

title: Senior Prompt Engineer (AI/ML)
description:
🚀 Prompt Engineer – AI for Inbound SalesJoin our well-funded, US-based startup with positions available in Saigon or remotely in Southeast Asia. Know someone who’d be a great fit? Referrals welcome - and there’s a bonus!
🎯 What You’ll Do🧠 Design & Optimize AI Conversations – Craft and refine prompts to improve sales interactions at care center.🤖 Automate & Enhance AI Responses – Develop testing frameworks to ensure accuracy and engagement.📊 Analyze & Improve AI Performance – Fine-tune responses for better lead conversion.🤝 Collaborate Across Teams – Align AI strategies with business goals.📞 Integrate AI with VoIP & CRM – Make every interaction seamless.
🎓 What You Bring (Must-have)✅ 5+ years of total work experience – Demonstrating professional maturity and expertise.✅ Excellent English communication skills – Confidently work directly with US clients.✅ Client-facing experience – Comfortable engaging with clients, understanding needs, and delivering solutions.✅ Proactive, self-directed approach – Ability to take ownership, navigate challenges, and drive tasks forward independently.✅ Bachelor’s in Computer Science, AI/ML, or related field – A strong technical foundation.✅ 1+ years in prompt engineering or conversational AI – Hands-on expertise in the field.✅ 1+ years of deep understanding of LLMs & automated testing – Your skills make a difference.✅ Proficiency in Python (or similar) – Bonus points for coding capabilities.
🌟 Bonus Points For🚀 AI-driven sales systems & API integration experience.☁️ Cloud platforms & real-time VoIP support know-how.📜 Certifications in AI/NLP technologies.
🚀Join us in transforming inbound sales with cutting-edge AI technology. Apply now by sending email to: backoffice@synergieglobal.com and let's build something incredible together!

title: Fullstack Prompt Engineer
description:
About Us
We are a team of multidisciplinary experts in artificial intelligence, cryptography, and software engineering who collaborate to build solutions for unsolved problems in web3. We work on challenges such as trust-minimized micropayments, low-latency request processing, data verification, and dynamic pricing. We’ve published research at prestigious AI conferences like NeurIPS and developed novel optimization algorithms. We make web3 smarter and verifiable.
We are a core developer of The Graph protocol ($1B+ market cap), an indexing protocol for organizing and accessing the world’s data. We are also the parent company of Odos, a market-leading liquidity aggregator that supports $5B+ in monthly trading volume.
You can learn more about Semiotic Labs at semiotic.ai or by watching this presentation.
Is This Role For You?
This role is for you if you enjoy working with a multidisciplinary team that solves tough, unsolved problems through a combination of research and engineering. This role is for you if you’re passionate about working on a small, agile team where your daily contributions deliver innovation both within the team and throughout the web3 ecosystem. This role is for you if you are focused on delivering value to users.
Responsibilities
Software Engineering:Develop quick prototypes of user-facing AI productsWork with customers to understand requirements
Collaboration and Leadership:Work closely with industry-leading engineers and researchersFoster a collaborative learning environmentDemonstrate a growth mindset and set high standards through personal example
Technical Expertise:Familiarity with LLM frameworks, prompting techniques, and finetuningExperience with Knowledge Graphs and Vector StoresFamiliarity with OOP principles and best practicesExperience in PythonExperience with blockchains and/or web3 (bonus)Experience using collaborative development best practices (Git, Kanban, code reviews)
Personal Attributes:Strong ability to work autonomously in a fast-paced, dynamic environmentInitiative to take ownership of projects and commitment to delivering value to usersExcellent English communication skills, collaborative mindset, and dedication to continuous learning
Experience:Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience2+ years of software engineering and AI experience
Perks and Benefits
Remote: We operate as a fully remote team, primarily located in the Americas, with global off-site gatherings.Leadership Growth: You'll report directly to the Head of Engineering within our expanding team.Career Development: Deepen your expertise in web3, AI, cryptography, and software engineering alongside industry experts.

title: Prompt Engineer
description:
Job Description:

AI Prompt Engineer– (Remote Opportunity) 

We’re looking for a GenAI Prompt Engineer who thrives on innovation, loves problem-solving, and wants to make AI more intelligent, efficient, and impactful. In this role, you'll craft enterprise-level AI solutions, develop smart automation tools, and refine generative AI models to ensure reliable, high-quality outputs. You’ll collaborate across teams—from chatbot development to financial transaction analysis—helping shape AI-driven strategies that deliver real-world impact.

What You’ll Do (And Why It Matters)

Engineer smarter AI models – Design and refine prompts, fine-tune models, and leverage techniques like Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and Hallucination Prevention to ensure accuracy and reliability.Turn complex data into AI-driven insights – Mine and analyze large datasets, identify trends, and optimize AI performance to drive business value.Build AI-powered products that scale – Develop robust, secure, and production-ready AI applications on Azure, ensuring high availability and performance.Solve real-world problems with AI – From conversational AI to financial risk analysis, you’ll apply Chain-of-Thought and Tree-of-Thoughts methodologies to enhance AI reasoning and problem-solving.Collaborate, innovate, and lead – Work with product managers, engineers, and stakeholders to align AI initiatives with business goals, all while shaping best practices in AI development.


What You Bring To The Table

AI & ML expertise – Hands-on experience with generative AI, LLMs, prompt engineering techniques, and cloud AI services (Azure preferred).Software engineering background – 10+ years of experience in software development, with a strong understanding of scalable architectures and AI-driven applications.Data-driven mindset – Ability to analyze massive datasets, optimize model performance, and ensure AI outputs align with real-world business needs.Creative problem-solving – Comfortable working with loosely defined requirements and using AI to find innovative solutions.Strong communication skills – You can break down complex AI concepts for stakeholders and collaborate effectively across teams.A passion for learning – AI is evolving fast, and we need someone eager to stay ahead of the curve and experiment with new technologies.


What’s in It for You?

Remote-first flexibility – Work from anywhere while making a real impact.Innovative environment – Join a team that’s shaping the future of AI, where your ideas will be heard (and implemented!).Career growth – Opportunities to deepen your AI expertise, take on leadership roles, and work on groundbreaking projects.High-impact work – Your AI solutions will drive real business value, powering everything from chatbots to financial analysis tools.


Other Qualifications

The Winning Way behaviors that all Vertex employees need in order to meet the expectations of each other, our customers, and our partners.

Communicate with Clarity - Be clear, concise and actionable. Be relentlessly constructive. Seek and provide meaningful feedback.Act with Urgency - Adopt an agile mentality - frequent iterations, improved speed, resilience. 80/20 rule – better is the enemy of done. Don’t spend hours when minutes are enough.Work with Purpose - Exhibit a “We Can” mindset. Results outweigh effort. Everyone understands how their role contributes. Set aside personal objectives for team results.Drive to Decision - Cut the swirl with defined deadlines and decision points. Be clear on individual accountability and decision authority. Guided by a commitment to and accountability for customer outcomes.Own the Outcome - Defined milestones, commitments and intended results. Assess your work in context, if you’re unsure, ask. Demonstrate unwavering support for decisions.


COMMENTS:

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals in this position. Other functions may be assigned, and management retains the right to add or change the duties at any time.

title: Prompt Engineer
description: Job Description: Prompt EngineerOverviewWe are seeking a highly skilled and creative Prompt Engineer to join our innovative team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing, optimizing, and maintaining AI-driven prompts to enhance user interactions and improve the overall efficiency of our AI systems.Key ResponsibilitiesDesign and Develop Prompts: Create and refine prompts that effectively guide users in interacting with AI systems to ensure accurate and relevant responses.Optimization: Continuously analyze and improve prompt performance to enhance user experience and operational efficiency.Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software developers, and UX designers, to align prompt strategies with business objectives.Testing and Evaluation: Conduct rigorous testing and evaluation of prompts to ensure their functionality and effectiveness in real-world scenarios.Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of prompt development processes, methodologies, and best practices.Stay Updated: Keep abreast of the latest advancements in AI and NLP technologies to integrate new techniques and approaches into prompt engineering.RequirementsEducation: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.Experience: Proven experience in AI, NLP, or related areas, with a focus on prompt engineering or conversational AI.Technical Skills: Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, and familiarity with AI/ML frameworks and tools.Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and address prompt performance issues.Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Attention to Detail: High level of attention to detail and accuracy in prompt design and evaluation.Creativity: Ability to think creatively and develop innovative solutions to complex challenges.Preferred QualificationsIndustry Experience: Experience working in a tech-driven environment or with consumer-facing AI products.Project Management: Experience in project management and working in agile development environments.Certifications: Relevant certifications in AI, ML, or NLP.

title: AI Automation Engineer – Process Optimization - Prompt Engineer - Remote
description:
AI Automation Engineer – Process Optimization

About RoverPass

RoverPass is a fast-growing startup in the hospitality and travel industry, providing cutting-edge reservation and operational solutions for RV parks and campgrounds. As we scale, we are looking for an AI Automation Engineer to develop and implement AI-driven automation solutions that optimize workflows, reduce manual workloads, and improve overall efficiency across the company.

What You’ll Do

Identify manual, repetitive, and high-effort processes across different teams and develop AI-driven automation solutions.Design and optimize AI prompts and models to streamline operations in customer support, finance, HR, marketing, and other business functions.Develop AI systems that improve decision-making, data analysis, and task execution without human intervention.Implement LLM-powered automation, such as AI-assisted recruitment screening, AI-driven customer support, and automated financial workflows.Work with OpenAI APIs (GPT-4, Whisper, TTS) and explore alternative frameworks like Google Cloud AI, Deepgram, AssemblyAI, or RPA (Robotic Process Automation) tools.Integrate AI solutions into existing company tools, databases, and workflows to maximize efficiency.Continuously test, refine, and improve automation solutions based on performance data and business needs.

What We’re Looking For

✅ Experience in AI-driven automation, prompt engineering, or process optimization.

✅ Strong understanding of LLMs (Large Language Models), RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation), and AI fine-tuning.

✅ Hands-on experience with AI APIs (OpenAI, Google Cloud AI, AWS AI, etc.) and workflow automation tools (Zapier, Airflow, UiPath, etc.).

✅ Ability to analyze business processes and implement AI-based automation solutions.

✅ Experience integrating AI solutions with business tools like CRM, ATS, ERP, and customer service platforms.

✅ Familiarity with Python, Ruby, or Node.js for AI automation and API integrations.

✅ Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive approach to process improvement.

Why Join RoverPass?

🚀 Shape the future of AI-driven automation in a fast-growing startup.

🌎 Remote-first culture with flexible work arrangements.

📈 Work on impactful projects that reduce costs and improve efficiency across departments.

💡 Be at the forefront of AI-powered business transformation.

description:

We specialize in identifying and implementing AI-driven architectures that support the development and deployment of intelligent, cloud-native applications.Through our services, we help our customers to create safe and reliable innovations that guarantee a real competitive advantage in the market:
GenAI-Native Platform Implementation: We specialize in deploying GenAI-powered applications across software development, integration, and testing, enabling organizations to accelerate the adoption of Generative AI solutions while ensuring robustness, security, and scalability.Accelerated AI Capabilities: Our services drive the rapid adoption of Generative AI by integrating advanced AI models into enterprise environments, unlocking new opportunities for automation, content generation, knowledge management, and enhanced decision-making.Advanced AI Architectures: Our expertise lies in designing architectures that seamlessly integrate Generative AI models with enterprise systems, enabling a secure, scalable, and compliant AI ecosystem that maximizes business value.
#OurRequirements
Key Qualifications
Proven experience working with Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI architectures for tasks such as text generation, summarization, translation, code generation, and multimodal AI applications.Mastery in designing effective and optimized prompts, leveraging Few-shot learning, Chain-of-Thought (CoT), Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), and Self-Consistency prompting to enhance model performance and contextual accuracy.Hands-on experience integrating Generative AI models into enterprise applications, chatbots, virtual assistants, and knowledge management systems using LangChain, LlamaIndex, or similar orchestration tools.Strong understanding of LLM inference optimization, model distillation, parameter-efficient fine-tuning (LoRA, QLoRA), and deployment strategies on cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP), on-premises, and edge environments.Expertise in embedding models, vector databases, and RAG pipelines to enhance model relevance and contextual understanding.Strong experience with LLM APIs (e.g. OpenAI, Anthropic) and open-source model hosting, including running private AI models in secure environments for enterprises.

Bonus Qualifications
Experience in fine-tuning and adapting foundation models (e.g., GPT, Claude, Gemini, LLaMA) using domain-specific datasets, reinforcement learning (RLHF), and instruction tuning techniques.Hands-on experience with Django and FastAPI for building scalable backend services and APIs for Generative AI applications. Experience with React.js for developing interactive AI-powered user interfaces and front-end experiences.Familiarity and use of any VCS (e.g., git)Experience with Docker and Kubernetes

title: Prompt Engineer
description:
Prompt Engineer (AIML) — Remote (US/LATAM)
We are seeking a highly skilled Prompt Engineer to develop, refine, and optimize natural language prompts for AI/ML applications. You will work with a globally distributed team on cutting-edge projects that leverage large language models to create scalable and innovative solutions.
Responsibilities:Craft and refine prompts to enhance the efficiency and accuracy of language models.Partner with AI engineers, data scientists, and product teams to seamlessly incorporate prompt engineering into AI-driven applications.Design and conduct experiments, including A/B testing, to assess and improve prompting techniques.Stay informed about the latest research, tools, and best practices in NLP, generative AI, and machine learning.
Requirements:Hands-on experience working with large language models (LLMs) like GPT or BERT, along with NLP frameworks.Strong knowledge of AI/ML methodologies, including prompt design, fine-tuning models, and tokenization strategies.Proficiency in Python or similar programming languages commonly used in AI/ML development.Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities with a strong attention to detail.
Nice to Have:Experience with cloud computing services such as AWS, GCP, or Azure, as well as MLOps workflows.Familiarity with version control tools (e.g., Git) and collaborative software development practices.
What We Offer:Fully remote role with a flexible schedule.Competitive compensation and growth opportunities.A dynamic team committed to advancing state-of-the-art AI solutions.
